citations.narrative:
The end of one rope hanging near the swinging perch on the right side of the exhibit housing 8 red ruffed lemurs is worn
and frayed . Frayed rope may become entangled around digits of the animals or ingested by the animals resulting in
injury. The rope must be repaired, replaced or removed to prevent injury. Objects in the housing facilities must be sturdily
constructed and strong enough to provide for the safe activity and welfare of non human primates.
CORRECT BY : 4/12/23

Two sides of the wooden box in the enclosure housing 2 kangaroo and 1 cavy have areas where the wood is chewed and
splintered. Rough splintered wood poses an area where animals could be injured as they enter the box. These areas
must be repaired or replaced and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury .
CORRECT BY : 4/15/2023

The paint has peeled off the floor in an area by the door inside the exhibit housing 2 kinkajous. Sanitation will be difficult in
this area due to the condition of the floor. The floor surface must be repaired to ensure proper sanitation. Premises shall
be kept in good repair to facilitate husbandry practices.
CORRECT BY : 5/11/2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the husbandry manager.
n

narrative:
3.75(c)(1) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The end of one rope hanging near the swinging perch on the right side of the exhibit housing 8 red ruffed lemurs is worn 
and frayed . Frayed rope may become entangled around digits of the animals or ingested by the animals resulting in 
injury. The rope must be repaired, replaced or removed to prevent injury.  Objects in the housing facilities must be sturdily 
constructed and strong enough to provide for the safe activity and welfare of non human primates. 
CORRECT BY : 4/12/23 
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
Two sides of the wooden box in the enclosure housing 2 kangaroo and 1 cavy have areas where the wood is chewed and 
splintered. Rough splintered wood poses an area where animals could be injured as they enter the box. These areas 
must be repaired or replaced  and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury .  
CORRECT BY : 4/15/2023 
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
The paint has peeled off the floor in an area by the door inside the exhibit housing 2 kinkajous. Sanitation will be difficult in 
this area due to the condition of the floor. The floor surface must be repaired to ensure proper sanitation. Premises shall

be kept in good repair to facilitate husbandry practices.  
CORRECT BY : 5/11/2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the husbandry manager.
